intro: Pisum sativum var. wardii, commonly known as the Ward's pea, is a variety of the common pea plant. It is characterized by its distinctive pod and seed morphology, which differ from the standard Pisum sativum. This variety is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in temperate climates. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its seeds are often used in traditional culinary practices and have been studied for their nutritional and agricultural significance.
